function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Modification of HVAC control strategies may not be straightforward and could lead to unintended consequences for temperature, humidity, and air flow distribution.","Impact":"Poor modification of HVAC systems could result in inadequate ventilation and increased risks of airborne disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Consult with HVAC engineers and experts to develop and implement safe and effective modification strategies for HVAC systems.","Technologies":"HVAC system simulation software and monitoring tools.","People":"Building owners, facility managers, and HVAC engineers.","Owner":"HVAC engineers, building owners, and facility managers."},{"Description":"Customization of ventilation systems can introduce new design vulnerabilities and potential failure points, increasing the risk of airborne disease transmission.","Impact":"Inadequate customization of ventilation systems could create pathways for airborne disease transmission within buildings.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough risk assessments and simulations to identify and address potential design vulnerabilities in customized ventilation systems.","Technologies":"Building information modeling (BIM) software and advanced airflow simulation tools.","People":"HVAC engineers, building owners, and facility managers.","Owner":"HVAC engineers and building owners."},{"Description":"Dependence on natural ventilation methods may result in inconsistent and unreliable outdoor air flow rates, leading to varying levels of ventilation effectiveness.","Impact":"Inconsistent outdoor air flow rates could lead to inadequate ventilation in some areas of the building, increasing the risk of airborne disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Implement sensors and monitoring systems to continuously assess and adjust natural ventilation effectiveness based on current outdoor conditions.","Technologies":"Building automation systems and outdoor air quality sensors.","People":"Building owners, facility managers, and HVAC engineers.","Owner":"Building owners and facility managers."}]}
